intro: Hieracium paramorphum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a serrated edge, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium paramorphum is known for its ability to colonize disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and slopes at high altitudes.
